  "description": "GoodLand Proconsult Limited is a dynamic consulting firm dedicated to helping businesses thrive through expert guidance and tailored solutions. Our mission is to become a trusted leader in the consultancy space by delivering personalized, results-driven support that aligns with each client&rsquo;s unique goals. Choose GoodLand Proconsult LTD, where your success is our mission and your satisfaction is our promise

We are recruiting to fill the position below:

Job Position: Executive Administrative Associate
Job Location:&nbsp;Nigeria
Employment Type: Contract

Job Overview


	We are seeking a highly organized and proactive Remote Executive Administrative Associate to manage the efficiency of our daily operations.
	The ideal candidate will handle a wide range of administrative and clerical tasks, including basic payroll processing, ensuring smooth communication across departments, providing excellent client support, and coordinating resources effectively.
	This is a remote position, so the ability to work independently and stay self-motivated is essential.


Responsibilities


	Manage communication channels to ensure effective internal and external coordination.
	Oversee the maintenance and organization of digital files, office systems, and records.
	Compute payroll taxes and perform tax-related calculations when required.
	Prepare and process payroll, create and distribute payslips.
	Schedule client meetings and support departmental communication.
	Perform general administrative support tasks to maintain operational efficiency.


Qualifications


	HND, OND, or Bachelor&rsquo;s degree in Business Administration, Communications, or a related field.
	Highly proficient in Excel


Key Skills:


	Highly professional, accountable, and proactive, with a strong focus on achieving results.
	Exceptional attention to detail and a proven ability to meet strict deadlines.
	Strong communication and customer service skills.
	Excellent organizational and multitasking abilities.
	Ability to work independently and remotely, with a proactive attitude.
	Demonstrated ability to handle client information with the highest level of confidentiality.
	Proficiency with office equipment and digital tools.
	Knowledge of basic payroll
	Highly proactive, organized, and tech-savvy (Google Workspace, project management tools)

	Salary: N70,000 - N100,000 Monthly.
	Remote and flexible working arrangements.
	Opportunity to gain valuable experience in a consulting environment.
	Professional growth and development opportunities.
	Healthy work-life balance.

	Deadline 31st August 2025 11:59 PM.
	Please be aware that applications will be reviewed on a rolling basis, so we encourage you to apply early.
	Due to the high volume of applications, only shortlisted candidates will be contacted for an interview.

Executive Administrative Associate Job at GoodLand Proconsult Limited




        
    

        
        GoodLand Proconsult Limited is a dynamic consulting firm dedicated to helping businesses thrive through expert guidance and tailored solutions. We partner with organizations to streamline operations, improve compliance, and implement effective strategies that drive growth and efficiency. Our mission is to become a trusted leader in the consultancy space by delivering personalized, results-driven support that aligns with each client’s unique goals. Choose GoodLand Proconsult LTD, where your success is our mission and your satisfaction is our promise

We are recruiting to fill the position below:

Job Position: Executive Administrative Associate
Job Location: Nigeria
Employment Type: Contract
     

            
    



Job Overview


	We are seeking a highly organized and proactive Remote Executive Administrative Associate to manage the efficiency of our daily operations.
	The ideal candidate will handle a wide range of administrative and clerical tasks, including basic payroll processing, ensuring smooth communication across departments, providing excellent client support, and coordinating resources effectively.
	This is a remote position, so the ability to work independently and stay self-motivated is essential.


Responsibilities


	Manage communication channels to ensure effective internal and external coordination.
	Oversee the maintenance and organization of digital files, office systems, and records.
	Compute payroll taxes and perform tax-related calculations when required.
	Prepare and process payroll, create and distribute payslips.
	Schedule client meetings and support departmental communication.
	Perform general administrative support tasks to maintain operational efficiency.


Qualifications


	HND, OND, or Bachelor’s degree in Business Administration, Communications, or a related field.
	Highly proficient in Excel


Key Skills:


	Highly professional, accountable, and proactive, with a strong focus on achieving results.
	Exceptional attention to detail and a proven ability to meet strict deadlines.
	Strong communication and customer service skills.
	Excellent organizational and multitasking abilities.
	Ability to work independently and remotely, with a proactive attitude.
	Demonstrated ability to handle client information with the highest level of confidentiality.
	Proficiency with office equipment and digital tools.
	Knowledge of basic payroll
	Highly proactive, organized, and tech-savvy (Google Workspace, project management tools)


Benefits


	Salary: N70,000 - N100,000 Monthly.
	Remote and flexible working arrangements.
	Opportunity to gain valuable experience in a consulting environment.
	Professional growth and development opportunities.
	Healthy work-life balance.


Method of Application
Interested and qualified candidates should submit their CV to: recruitment@goodlandproconsult.com using the Job Position (Example "Aggro Ben/Executive Administrative Associate "as the subject of the email.

Note


	Applications that do not follow this format will not be considered.
	You are encouraged to include a good cover letter.
	Deadline 31st August 2025 11:59 PM.
	Please be aware that applications will be reviewed on a rolling basis, so we encourage you to apply early.
	Due to the high volume of applications, only shortlisted candidates will be contacted for an interview.

Front-End Developer Job at Unified Payment Services Limited




        
    

        
        Unified Payment Services Limited is Nigeria’s premier Payments & Financial Technology company that operates as a shared infrastructure for the banking community in Nigeria and Payments Service Provider within and outside Nigeria, with a vision to be the most preferred e-payment service provider in Africa.

We are recruiting to fill the position below:

Job Position: Front-End Developer

Job Location: Lagos
Employment Type: Full-time

Job Objective(s)
Overview:
     

            
    




	A Front-End Developer is the architect of the user experience, responsible for crafting bthe interactive elements and visual design that users see and interact with on a website or web application.
	They translate design mockups and user stories into functional and visually appealing user interfaces (UIs) using various programming languages and frameworks.


Duties & Responsibilities


	Collaborate with designers and back-end developers to understand project requirements and translate them into front-end components.
	Develop user interfaces using HTML, CSS, and JavaScript (often referred to as the "front-end development trinity").
	Implement interactive features and animations using JavaScript libraries and frameworks (e.g., React and Angular).
	Ensure website responsiveness and optimal user experience across various devices (desktop, mobile, tablet) through responsive web design (RWD) techniques.
	Optimize website performance for speed and efficiency, considering factors like page load times and resource utilization.
	Write clean, well-documented, and maintainable code according to best practices.
	Implement accessibility features to ensure the website is usable by everyone, regardless of their abilities.
	Conduct browser testing and debugging to identify and fix any UI issues or functionality errors.
	Stay up-to-date with the latest front-end development trends and technologies.


Qualifications


	Interested candidates should possess a Bachelor’s Degree
	Proven experience as a Front-End Developer with Minimum of 4 years of experience
	Solid understanding of HTML, CSS, and JavaScript fundamentals
	Experience with front-end frameworks and libraries
	Strong understanding of web design principles and best practices
	Experience with responsive web design (RWD)
	Excellent problem-solving and analytical skills
	Strong communication and collaboration skills
	Ability to work independently and as part of a team.


Additional Skills (may be desired depending on the specific role):


	Experience with content management systems (CMS)
	Experience with front-end performance optimization techniques
	Experience with accessibility testing and best practices
	Experience with version control systems (e.g., Git).


Method of Application
Interested and qualified candidates should send their CV to: opeoluwa.oluyemi@up-ng.com using the Job Position as the subject of the email.

Senior Accountant Job at Miva Open University




        
    

        
        
     

            
    

Miva Open University is an education company building a new kind of university targeted at the African region. Miva, a subsidiary of the uLesson Group, is a Pan-African Distance e-Learning University that is built on a couple of beliefs: Firstly, we believe that the traditional brick-and-mortar approach to tertiary education is no longer a viable option for serving learners on the African continent. This approach will not provide the capacity and efficacy for the people of the region. We are building a university experience that leverages excellent academic talent (wherever it is to be found) and digital technologies to create a new, fresh, more efficacious and more accessible tertiary experience. Our second belief is that this new tertiary experience must not only meet but exceed the existing way of doing things in terms of quality, efficacy and preparing learners for the future. We are uncompromising in these beliefs and this is why we are excited to speak to you.

We are recruiting to fill the position below:

Job Position: Senior Accountant
Job Location: Abuja
Employment Type: Full-time

Job Description


	The Senior Accountant will be responsible for maintaining accurate financial records, ensuring regulatory compliance, and supporting strategic decision-making through high-quality reporting and controls.
	This role requires a hands-on professional with deep accounting knowledge and a strong command of financial systems. Experience with Zoho Books is a plus.


Roles and Responsibilities


	Prepare and maintain general ledger entries, ensuring monthly reconciliations are completed on time.
	Oversee the preparation of monthly, quarterly, and annual financial statements in compliance with IFRS and Nigerian GAAP.
	Lead month-end and year-end closing activities.
	Ensure proper accounting of receivables, payables, accruals, and prepayments.
	Maintain the fixed asset register and support periodic asset verification.
	Ensure compliance with all statutory obligations, including VAT, PAYE, WHT, pension, and liaise with relevant regulatory bodies.
	Support the audit process by preparing schedules and responding to auditor inquiries.
	Enforce internal controls and identify areas for improvement.
	Contribute to budgeting, forecasting, and financial planning processes.
	Collaborate with cross-functional teams to ensure alignment of financial operations with business goals.


Requirements


	Bachelor's Degree in Accounting, Finance, or related discipline.
	Minimum 10 years of relevant accounting experience, including 3+ years in a senior or supervisory role.
	ICAN or ACCA certification is required.
	Strong knowledge of Nigerian tax laws, statutory reporting, and IFRS.
	Excellent attention to detail, organisational skills, and problem-solving abilities.
